data.name: Back

data.name: BluetoothSetupDescription
data.value: In this step you can initialize one or more Bluetooth hosts.
data.comment: Text directly visible under the title, showing a quick description of the Bluetooth driver setup

data.name: BluetoothSetupInitialized
data.value: Initialized Bluetooth Hosts
data.comment: Header of the group of Bluetooth hosts ready for usage

data.name: BluetoothSetupInstalling
data.value: Installing WinUSB driver on Bluetooth Host Devices
data.comment: Text shown with the progress bar while installing the Bluetooth driver

data.name: BluetoothSetupPleasePlugIn
data.value: If you haven't already please plug in your Bluetooth host device (a.k.a. Bluetooth dongle) now and wait until it appears in the list on the right.
data.comment: Text asking the user to plug his Bluetooth dongle

data.name: BluetoothSetupStartInstall
data.value: Initialize all connected devices as Bluetooth Hosts
data.comment: Button to start the setup

data.name: BluetoothSetupSuccessInstruction
data.value: Bluetooth Hosts installed successfully
data.comment: Instruction of the setup success dialog box

data.name: BluetoothSetupTitle
data.value: Install Bluetooth hosts
data.comment: Title shown on the Bluetooth driver install page

data.name: BluetoothSetupUninitialized
data.value: Uninitialized Bluetooth Hosts
data.comment: Header of the group of Bluetooth hosts not ready for usage

data.name: BluetoothSetupWarningAfterLink
data.value: first!
data.comment: The text shown after the link on the warning for the Bluetooth setup

data.name: BluetoothSetupWarningBeforeLink
data.value: You need to sacrifice a dedicated Bluetooth dongle that will get reserved for use with wireless controllers only. If you're using a wireless mouse and/or keyboard via the listed dongle and install the driver, you will lose connection instantly and permanently! If you're unsure what to do next,
data.comment: The text shown before the link on the warning for the Bluetooth setup

data.name: BluetoothSetupWarningLink
data.value: please consult the documentation
data.comment: The text shown on the warning for the Bluetooth setup, points to the documentation

data.name: Cancel
data.value: Cancel
data.comment: Cancel button

data.value: In this step you can initialize one or more DualShock 3/4 controllers.
data.comment: Text directly visible under the title, showing a quick description of the DualShock driver setup

data.name: DualShockSetupInitialized
data.value: Initialized DualShock Controllers
data.comment: Header of the group of DualShock controllers ready for usage

data.name: DualShockSetupInstalling3
data.value: Installing WinUSB driver on DualShock 3 Devices
data.comment: Text shown with the progress bar while installing the DualShock 3 driver

data.name: DualShockSetupInstalling4
data.value: Installing WinUSB driver on DualShock 4 Devices
data.comment: Text shown with the progress bar while installing the DualShock 4 driver

data.name: DualShockSetupPleasePlugIn
data.value: If you haven't already, please plug in your DualShock 3 (or 4) controller with the USB cable now and wait until it appears in the list on the right.
data.comment: Text asking the user to plug his controllers

data.name: DualShockSetupStartInstall
data.value: Initialize all connected devices as DualShock 3/4 Controllers
data.comment: Button to start the setup

data.name: DualShockSetupSuccessInstruction
data.value: DualShock controllers installed successfully
data.comment: Instruction of the setup success dialog box

data.value: Install DualShock 3/4 Controllers
data.comment: Title shown on the DualShock driver install page

data.name: DualShockSetupUninitialized

data.name: Finish
data.value: Finish
data.comment: Finish button

data.name: FinishedAutoService
data.value: Once you finished this wizard, the main service will be started and your controllers connected automatically.
data.comment: Text saying that the service will start automatically when the installer is closed

data.name: FinishedDescription
data.value: This is the last page in the process
data.comment: Text directly visible under the title, stating that this is the last page

data.name: FinishedThatsIt
data.value: That's it! Wasn't so bad now was it? Enjoy your games!
data.comment: Little text saying that the process wasn't so bad

data.name: FinishedTitle
data.value: Installation finished
data.comment: Title shown on the end page

data.name: Help
data.value: Help
data.comment: Help button

data.name: Next
data.value: Next >
data.comment: Next button

data.name: RebootRequiredContent
data.value: A reboot is required for the driver installation to complete. Please restart your machine after you finished this installation wizard.
data.comment: Content of the reboot required dialog box

data.name: RebootRequiredTitle
data.value: Reboot required
data.comment: Title of the reboot required dialog box

data.name: ServiceSetupDescription
data.value: In this step you can install the Windows Service.
data.comment: Test directly visible under the title, showing a quick description of the Service setup

data.name: ServiceSetupIfAlreadyPresent
data.value: If the service is already installed, it will automatically get started after the Driver Installer has finished.
data.comment: Explain what will be done if the Service is already installed

data.name: ServiceSetupInstallationRequired
data.value: This is basically the core logic of the toolkit so installation is necessary for everything to function correctly.
data.comment: Explains that the service is required for ScpToolkit to work

data.name: ServiceSetupInstalling
data.value: Installing Windows Service
data.comment: Text shown with the progress bar while installing the Windows Service

data.name: ServiceSetupStartInstall
data.value: Install Windows Service
data.comment: Button to start the setup

data.name: ServiceSetupSuccessContent
data.value: Congratulations! It looks like the service was installed properly, please proceed to the next step.
data.comment: Content of the setup success dialog box

data.name: ServiceSetupSuccessInstruction
data.value: Service installed successfully
data.comment: Instruction of the setup success dialog box

data.name: ServiceSetupTitle
data.value: Install Windows Service
data.comment: Title shown on the Windows Service install page

data.name: ServiceSetupWhyIsItNeeded
data.value: Handling USB/Bluetooth connections and translating data back and forth between controllers and the XInput emulator driver is done via a Windows Service.
data.comment: Text explaining what does the Service do

data.name: SetupFailedContent
data.value:
I'm sorry to inform you that some of your devices weren't installed properly.
Sadly, there are too many possibilities of why it failed to cram all suggested resolutions in one of these info boxes, but I can give you some hints on resolving the issue:
1. Re-open this Driver Installer and simply try again. Seriously, try it. 2. Reboot your machine. It's Windows, so it might help. 3. Check your cabling. Your cat might have gnawed on your USB cable. 4. Is your controller listen under "Human Interface Devices" in Device Manager? If not, it might be equipped with the wrong driver for whatever reason. Find it and revert to the default device driver. 5. ??? 6. See what I meant? This list is already getting too long, click the link in the footer if you need more help!
data.comment: Troubleshooting steps for the setup failed dialog box

data.name: SetupFailedFooter
data.value: If you can't resolve this issue by yourself, check out the online documentation.
data.comment: Refers to documentation in the setup failed dialog box

data.name: SetupFailedInstructions
data.value: One or more installation tasks failed or did not complete
data.comment: Little summary of the setup failed dialog box

data.name: SetupFailedTitle
data.value: Installation failed
data.comment: Title of the setup failed dialog box

data.name: SetupFailedVerbose
data.value: Installer result: {0} ({1})
data.comment: Details about why it failed in the setup failed dialog box

data.name: SetupIfNotShowingUp
data.value: If the device doesn't show up after a few seconds, it's either already equipped with the right driver or in a faulty state.
data.comment: Text informing the user about why the device doesn't show up

data.name: SetupPleaseStartInstall
data.value: Once your device becomes visible, hit the button below to start the driver installation process for this particular device.
data.comment: Text prompting the user to start the setup

data.name: SetupSuccessContent
data.value: Congratulations! It looks like the necessary drivers are in their proper place, please proceed to the next step.
data.comment: Success text for the setup success dialog box

data.name: SetupSuccessTitle
data.value: Installation successful
data.comment: Title for the setup success dialog box

data.name: Title
data.value: ScpToolkit Driver Installer
data.comment: Text shown on the status bar

data.name: VirtualBusSetupAddingDriverStore
data.value: Installing Virtual Bus Driver in Windows Driver Store
data.comment: Text shown with the progress bar while adding the Virtual Bus driver to the Driver Store

data.name: VirtualBusSetupCreating
data.value: Creating Hardware ID for Virtual Bus
data.comment: Text shown with the progress bar while creating the Virtual Bus

data.name: VirtualBusSetupDescription
data.value: In this step you can install the virtual Xbox 360 Controller driver.
data.comment: Text directly visible under the title, showing the user a quick desciption of the Virtual Bus setup

data.name: VirtualBusSetupIfAlreadyPresent
data.value: If the virtual bus device is already present on your system (because you're upgrading from an older version of ScpServer/ScpToolkit or you've used tools like DS4Windows before), its driver will be automatically updated.
data.comment: Explains what will be done if the Virtual Bus is already installed

data.name: VirtualBusSetupInstalling
data.value: Installing driver on Virtual Bus
data.comment: Text shown with the progress bar while installing the Virtual Bus driver

data.name: VirtualBusSetupStartInstall
data.value: Install virtual Xbox 360 Controller driver
data.comment: Button to start the setup

data.name: VirtualBusSetupSuccessInstruction
data.value: Virtual Bus installed successfully
data.comment: Instruction of the setup success dialog box

data.name: VirtualBusSetupTitle
data.value: Install Xbox 360 Controller emulator driver.
data.comment: Title shown on the Virtual Bus install page

data.name: VirtualBusSetupToAvoidRestart
data.value: The Virtual Bus might also be used by other 3rd party tools running on your system (like DS4Windows, InputMapper, FreePIE, etc.), please make sure they are all closed/shut down to avoid system reboot.
data.comment: Text saying that other apps using the Virtual Bus needs to be close to avoid a reboot

data.name: VirtualBusSetupWhatWeWillDo
data.value: In this step we will attempt to install the virtual Xbox 360 Controller emulator driver (a.k.a. Scarlett.Crush Productions Virtual Bus Driver, ScpVBus or just Virtual Bus).
data.comment: A simple description of why we need to install the Virtual Bus

data.name: Warning
data.value: ..\Images\Warning.png;System.Drawing.Bitmap, System.Drawing, Version=4.0.0.0, Culture=neutral, PublicKeyToken=b03f5f7f11d50a3a

data.name: WelcomeDescription
data.value: This Wizard will walk you though the process of installing your Sony DualShock 3/4 controller(s) and/or Bluetooth hosts on your system.
data.comment: Text directly visible under the title, showing a quick description of the wizard

data.name: WelcomeGreetings
data.value: Greetings! This wizard will guide you through the installation process necessary to enjoy your Sony DualShock controller(s) on your Windows box and play Xbox-compatible (XInput) games using the DualShock!
data.comment: Welcome text

data.name: WelcomeTitle
data.value: Welcome to the ScpToolkit Driver Installer
data.comment: Title shown on the welcome page

data.name: Xbox360Driver
data.value: Microsoft Xbox 360 Controller driver
data.comment: Localised name of the Xbox 360 driver

data.name: Xbox360DriverNeededAfterLink
data.value: is required to be installed separately.
data.comment: Text shown after the link to the Xbox 360 driver installer

data.name: Xbox360DriverNeededBeforeLink
data.value: On Windows Vista/7 the
data.comment: Text shown before the link to the Xbox 360 driver installer

data.name: Xbox360DriverNeededInstallBeforeContinuing
data.value: Download and install the right edition before you continue this wizard.
data.comment: Text asking the user to install the Xbox 360 driver before going furter

data.name: Xbox360DriverNeededLink
data.value: Microsoft Xbox 360 Controller driver
data.comment: Text that will bring the user to the Xbox 360 driver installer
